page.title: 10JENNYCLIFF BEACH
page.content: When we first walked on to Jennycliff {Beach},we thought it looked very dirty and there was a bad smell. There was lots of seaweed scattered around the {pebbly and rocky shore.}It wasn't a nice place for swimming as the water was dirty and there was litter on the beach but the{views}of Plymouth Sound, Drakes Island, the Hoe and the Breakwater, were pleasant. We found that most of the people there were locals enjoying the view during their lunch times. There is a small hut next to the car park which serves food and drinks during the season, April to September, and a larger cafe. A few years ago this area was greatly improved by the removal of a caravan site and it is now very popular with {elderly people}who can enjoy the views from the car park without taking the steep steps to the beach.
